title: Vaibhav Suryavanshi's ton moves Dravid out of his wheelchair
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old prodigy, etched his name in IPL history by becoming the youngest centurion. Representing Rajasthan Royals, he blazed his way to a century in just 35 balls against Gujarat Titans at the Swaiman Singh Stadium. The record of fastest century in IPL belongs to former West Indies batter Chris Gayle, who had brought up his triple figure mark in 30 balls for Royal Challengers Bengaluru against Pune Warriors in April 2013.

title: Suryavanshi youngest ever to score T20 hundred, fastest Indian to IPL ton
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old Rajasthan Royals player, made history. He scored the youngest T20 century ever. Suryavanshi also achieved the fastest IPL hundred by an Indian. He reached his century in just 35 balls against Gujarat Titans. His innings included 11 sixes. He scored 101 runs off 38 balls. Rajasthan Royals had a strong start thanks to his performance.

title: India to get 26 Rafale-M jets by 2030 under deal inked with France
content: India has finalized a significant deal with France, procuring 26 Rafale-Marine jets for approximately Euro 7 billion. Deliveries are scheduled from mid-2028 to 2030, enhancing the Indian Navy's capabilities, especially for aircraft carrier operations. This acquisition aims to counter China's growing naval presence in the Indian Ocean, providing a substantial boost to India's maritime air power.

title: Pahalgam horror caught on cam: Zipliner inadvertently records terror attack
content: A chilling video has emerged from the Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26, capturing a tourist ziplining, oblivious to the unfolding violence. Gunshots echoed in the background as terrorists targeted tourists in Baisaran meadow, marking one of the region's deadliest incidents since the 2019 Pulwama attack. In response, India has taken stringent measures, including halting the Indus Waters Treaty with Pakistan

title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is not 'happy', says 'We should have been ... '
content: Elon Musk expressed his disappointment that humans haven't reached Mars yet, despite SpaceX's efforts. He referenced the rapid progress from the first flight to the moon landing, highlighting the current delay in space exploration.

title: 'Fears being treated like Zelenskyy: Why Xi is 'ghosting' Trump
content: China refuted President Trump's claim of recent tariff talks with Xi Jinping, escalating trade war tensions. This denial raises concerns about the global economy and Trump's strategy, as direct leader dialogue is absent. China's refusal to engage suggests a readiness to endure economic pain, while Trump's credibility faces scrutiny amid conflicting reports.

title: The sacrifices Vaibhav Suryavanshi made to become IPL's fastest Indian centurion
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old prodigy from Bihar, etched his name in IPL history, smashing a record-breaking century for Rajasthan Royals. He became the youngest player to achieve this feat, scoring 101 off 38 balls against Gujarat Titans. Suryavanshi's explosive innings, featuring 11 sixes, led his team to a comfortable victory.

title: Why CEO behind biggest Windows outage wishes he joined Microsoft before law school
content: Cloudflare CEO Matthew Prince advises his younger self to gain experience at a large company before pursuing graduate studies. Despite his success, Prince regrets declining job offers from tech giants like Yahoo and Microsoft after college.

title: Vaibhav Suryavanshi's record-breaking ton powers Rajasthan Royals to thumping win
content: Rajasthan Royals witnessed a historic moment as 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi smashed a record-breaking 101 off 38 balls against Gujarat Titans. His explosive innings, featuring 11 sixes, propelled the Royals to an eight-wicket victory. Suryavanshi's century is the fastest in IPL history by an Indian and the youngest in T20 cricket, overshadowing Shubman Gill's earlier impressive score.

title: 'Will use n-arsenal if ...': Pak min after claiming India invasion imminent
content: Following the deadly Pahalgam terrorist attack that killed 26, Pakistan's defence minister Khawaja Asif claimed an imminent Indian incursion, prompting heightened alert and reinforcement of forces. India's defence minister Rajnath Singh met with Prime Minister Modi to discuss counter-terrorism strategies after the attack. Nationwide protests have erupted, demanding strong action against Pakistan for supporting terrorism.

title: Tesla makes an offer to customers in Canada: Buy cars at ...
content: Tesla is urging Canadian customers to purchase vehicles at pre-tariff prices as the company anticipates price hikes due to ongoing trade tensions between the US and Canada.

title: 'Kargil mein bhi haraya tha': Shikhar Dhawan destroys Shahid Afridi
content: Shikhar Dhawan has strongly condemned Shahid Afridi's remarks blaming the Indian Army for the Pahalgam terror attack. Afridi questioned the army's efficiency and Pakistan's alleged involvement, drawing sharp criticism. Dhawan reminded Afridi of India's victory in Kargil and urged him to focus on his own country's progress instead of making baseless comments. He also expressed pride in the Indian Army.

title: 'Sanjiv Goenka 'never said anything wrong', KL Rahul was ... '
content: Sanjiv Goenka's interactions spark debate among cricket enthusiasts. Goenka's approach faces scrutiny after Lucknow Super Giants' defeats. Amit Mishra clarifies Goenka's role, emphasizing his support. Mishra highlights Goenka's motivation after losses. Lucknow Super Giants currently holds sixth position in the points table. The team has secured five wins and faced five losses in ten matches. Discussions continue regarding team dynamics.

title: Why prices of dryfruits may soon spike in India
content: Tensions between India and Pakistan have led to the closure of the Attari-Wagah border, jeopardizing dry fruit imports from Afghanistan, a key supplier to India. This disruption, coupled with Pakistan's trade suspension, is expected to cause a surge in domestic prices for almonds, raisins, and pistachios. Alternative routes are being explored, but uncertainty looms over the dry fruit supply chain.

title: 'Auction missteps ...': Jadeja on Dhoni-led CSK's IPL 2025 struggles
content: Ajay Jadeja says Chennai Super Kings' poor performance in IPL 2025 is due to their weak auction strategy last year. He points out that CSK's usual faith in players is wavering. Frequent changes in the playing eleven are visible this season. Jadeja highlights the team's struggle to find stability. He connects it to the uncertainty from the auction.

title: ‘Stay out': Canada's Poilievre snaps at Trump over '51st state' remark on polling day
content: Amidst Canada's federal election, Conservative leader Pierre Poilievre rebuked Donald Trump's suggestion of Canada becoming the 51st US state. Poilievre asserted that Canadians alone will determine their nation's future, urging Trump to stay out of their political affairs. He emphasized Canada's pride, sovereignty, and independence.

title: Army leak claims are fake, says PIB as India tightens vigil post Pahalgam attack
content: The Press Information Bureau (PIB) has debunked false claims circulating on social media regarding leaked confidential army preparedness documents, labeling them as fake amidst heightened tensions following the Pahalgam terror attack. Additionally, the defence ministry has cautioned the public about a fraudulent WhatsApp message soliciting donations for army modernisation, urging vigilance against such scams and reliance on official sources for accurate information.

title: Blackout hits Europe: Millions left in dark, trains stuck in tunnels
content: A massive blackout plunged millions across Spain, Portugal, and parts of southern France into darkness on Monday. Train services were severely disrupted in Spain, while Portugal's REN operator confirmed the widespread impact. The outage, which began around 12:30 pm local time, affected critical infrastructure, including Spain's Parliament and metro stations.

title: Harshit Rana admits missing Gautam Gambhir's 'aura' in KKR camp
content: Kolkata Knight Riders are feeling the absence of Gautam Gambhir. Harshit Rana acknowledges Gambhir's significant impact on the team. Rana highlights Gambhir's unique ability to unite the team. Abhishek Nayar's return is seen as a positive development for KKR. The team is currently seventh in the IPL standings. KKR aim to regain their winning form with these changes.

title: R Ashwin conferred Padma Shri by President Droupadi Murmu - WATCH
content: Ravichandran Ashwin received the Padma Shri from President Murmu at Rashtrapati Bhavan, as shared by the BCCI. Ashwin, who retired from international cricket after the Boxing Day Test against Australia last year, now plays for Chennai Super Kings in the IPL 2025. Alongside him, former hockey goalkeeper P.R.

title: 'Who killed your mother?': Owaisi slams Bhutto's 'blood will flow' remark
content: Asaduddin Owaisi criticized Bilawal Bhutto Zardari's threat regarding the Indus Waters Treaty, reminding him of his mother's assassination by terrorism. Owaisi questioned Zardari's understanding of terrorism's impact, highlighting the suffering it inflicts on innocent people. Zardari's remarks followed India's suspension of the treaty after a deadly terrorist attack in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: 'Meant to be!': Trump touts 51st state proposal as Canadians go to polls
content: As Canada heads to the polls for a crucial federal election, US President Donald Trump has made a renewed appeal for the country to join the United States. Trump promises economic prosperity and increased military power without tariffs or taxes if Canada becomes the 51st state.

title: Watch: Siddaramaiah loses cool, makes slapping gesture at cop on stage
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah faced controversy after gesturing at a police officer during a rally disruption by BJP workers in Belagavi. He also drew criticism from the BJP for suggesting India avoid war with Pakistan, prioritizing security. Siddaramaiah accused the BJP and media of misquoting him, clarifying he views war as a last resort.

title: Who is Karim Janat, the new weapon in Shubman Gill's GT arsenal?
content: Riyan Parag's Rajasthan Royals opted to bowl first after winning the toss against Gujarat Titans in their IPL 2025 match. Gujarat Titans, positioned second, aim to top the table with a victory, while Rajasthan Royals seek to improve their standing from ninth. Karim Janat, the Afghan all-rounder, makes his debut for Gujarat Titans in this crucial encounter.

title: Watch: Chaos erupts after major power outage hits Europe
content: A massive power outage plunged millions across Spain, Portugal, and parts of southern France into chaos on Monday. The blackout disrupted transport and communication systems, leaving people stranded in subway stations and causing widespread flight cancellations. Authorities are investigating the cause of the outage, which affected critical infrastructure and prompted selective power cuts to stabilize the network.

title: Former Pakistan cricketer slams Shahid Afridi over 'extremist' views
content: Danish Kaneria has strongly criticised Shahid Afridi for his extremist views and controversial statements, particularly blaming India for the Pahalgam terrorist attack. Kaneria accused Afridi of attempting to convert him to Islam and refusing to share meals. Afridi, in turn, accused India of orchestrating terror attacks and blamed Indian media for sensationalising the Pahalgam tragedy.

title: WWE RAW preview and streaming details: Match card, highlights, how to watch
content: WWE RAW returns with Nick Aldis filling in for Adam Pearce due to doctor's orders. The show features a segment with Seth Rollins, Bron Breakker, and Paul Heyman, dubbed "DatriFectaOfter." Rhea Ripley faces Roxanne Perez, while Becky Lynch addresses the WWE Universe after her feud with Lyra Valkyria. Logan Paul is also scheduled to appear on the Netflix broadcast.

title: Saquon Barkley reacts to WH visit with Trump: Here’s his response
content: Saquon Barkley’s White House visit with President Trump sparked backlash, with critics questioning his political alignment. Barkley’s bold response, defending his respect for the office and telling fans to “get out my mentions,” highlighted the intersection of sports and politics. His visit ignited a wider debate about athletes’ relationships with controversial political figures.

title: Man beaten, nearly thrown off moving train for watching Pahalgam terror reel
content: A 23-year-old man was allegedly abused and assaulted on a Bhopal-Indore passenger train for watching a reel about the Pahalgam terror attack. The two unidentified accused argued with the victim, made objectionable comments about India and the Constitution, and even threatened to throw him off the moving train. GRP has registered a case and is investigating using CCTV footage to identify the perpetrators.

title: Reduced to 'bag of bones': Husband, in-laws sentenced for starving woman to death
content: A Kerala court convicted a man and his mother for the dowry death of his wife, Thushara, in 2019. The 28-year-old victim was starved and weighed only 20-21 kilograms at the time of her death. Chandulal and Geetha were found guilty of torture and starvation, with the husband demanding additional dowry shortly after their marriage in 2013.

title: 'Hardik & his little Paltan': MI captain's special moment with a fan - Watch
content: Mumbai Indians secured a dominant 54-run victory against Lucknow Super Giants, marking their fifth consecutive win and propelling them to third place in the IPL 2025 standings. Captain Hardik Pandya's heartfelt gesture of gifting his cap to a young fan during the post-match celebrations at Wankhede went viral, highlighting the strong connection between the team and its supporters.

title: 'With what face can I ask for statehood for J&K?' CM Omar in assembly
content: Following the tragic terror attack in Pahalgam that resulted in 26 fatalities, Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah addressed the state assembly, expressing his grief and stating he would not demand statehood at this time. He emphasized that militancy can only be eradicated with the support of the people, not just through force.

title: 26/11 terror attack plotter Tahawwur Rana's custody extended by 12 days
content: An NIA court has extended the detention of Tahawwur Rana, accused in the 26/11 Mumbai terror attack, by 12 days after his extradition to India. Rana, reportedly uncooperative during questioning by Mumbai Police, appeared in court under tight security. The NIA seeks to further investigate the conspiracy, while Rana's legal team is provided by the Delhi Legal Services Authority.

title: Pope Francis' successor to be chosen in conclave starting May 7
content: Following the death of Pope Francis on April 21, 2025, at the age of 88, cardinals will convene in Rome to elect his successor. The conclave is set to begin on May 7, preceded by a solemn mass at St Peter's Basilica on May 3.

title: 'When I first met Virat Kohli ... ': Preity Zinta opens up
content: Following RCB's victory, Virat Kohli and Preity Zinta shared a heartwarming exchange, discussing their children and reminiscing about Kohli's early days. Kohli, currently the leading run-scorer in IPL 2025, also highlighted the importance of partnerships after RCB's win over Delhi Capitals, praising Krunal Pandya's contribution to the successful chase. As of now, Kohli is the leading run-scorer in IPL 2025, amassing 443 runs in 10 matches at an impressive average of 63.29, including six half-centuries.

title: Watch: DEA agents smash windows, arrest over 100 in Colorado Springs nightclub raid
content: In Colorado Springs, a DEA raid on an illegal after-hours nightclub resulted in over 100 suspected undocumented immigrants' arrests. The operation, involving 300 officers, followed investigations into drug trafficking and violent crime. Authorities seized cocaine and firearms. Donald Trump shared the raid footage, highlighting his administration's strict immigration enforcement.

title: Chewing or swallowing chia seeds: Best way to consume for hair growth
content: Chia seeds, rich in omega-3s, protein, and minerals, are beneficial for hair health. To maximize nutrient absorption for hair growth, soaking chia seeds is the most effective method. Chewing is a decent alternative, but swallowing them whole is less beneficial. Consistency in consumption, along with a balanced diet and proper hair care, is crucial for optimal results.

title: India, France sign Rs 63,000 crore mega deal to buy 26 Rafale Marine aircraft
content: India and France have finalized a significant deal. The agreement involves the purchase of 26 Rafale Marine aircraft for the Indian Navy. The deal is worth Rs 63,000 crore. These jets will operate from INS Vikrant. The contract includes weapons, training, and support. Deliveries are expected between 37 to 65 months. This acquisition enhances India's maritime capabilities.

title: Trae Young drops heartfelt 5-word reaction to Damian Lillard's latest injury
content: Damian Lillard's left foot injury during Game 4 against the Pacers has cast a pall over the Milwaukee Bucks' playoff aspirations. After recently returning from a calf injury, Lillard's Achilles tendon issue, potentially a tear, further complicates the Bucks' already precarious 3-1 series deficit. With a crucial Game 5 looming, the team's championship hopes hang in the balance.

title: Indian-origin man smashes windows of Pak High Commission in UK, held
content: Tensions between India and Pakistan have spilled over into London, marked by escalating protests from both diasporas. An Indian-origin man, Ankit Love, was arrested for allegedly vandalizing the Pakistani High Commission. These incidents follow a recent terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir, further straining the already fraught relationship between the two nations, leading to heightened security concerns in London.

title: Amir's fiery gesture to Viv Richards after Babar Azam's dismissal
content: In a high-octane Pakistan Super League clash, Mohammad Amir and Babar Azam reignited their rivalry. Amir struck Babar with a bouncer, later dismissing him with a sharp inswinger. Amir's emphatic celebration towards Viv Richards followed, though Richards urged him to remain composed. Amir finished with figures of 1/18, making a significant impact.

title: Preity Zinta reveals Shreyas was PBKS' only choice for captaincy at auction
content: Punjab Kings co-owner Preity Zinta lauded skipper Shreyas Iyer as a "down-to-earth guy and an amazing captain" during a recent social media Q&A. She revealed Iyer was PBKS's sole captaincy choice at the 2024 IPL auction, shaping their entire strategy. Under Iyer's leadership, Punjab Kings are currently fifth in the IPL 2025 standings, firmly in playoff contention.

title: Sources: Bucks' Lillard has torn Achilles tendon
content: Bucks star Damian Lillard has been diagnosed with a torn left Achilles tendon, sources told ESPN. The injury ends his season and also puts his 2025-26 season in jeopardy.

title: Bills GM testy with radio hosts over draft criticism
content: Bills general manager Brandon Beane began a Monday morning radio appearance with a strong response to criticism against the team's approach to the wide receiver position.

title: Commanders, D.C. reach deal for $4B stadium
content: The Commanders agreed to a deal with the District of Columbia to build a new $4 billion stadium at the RFK site, which was the team's home from 1961 to 1996.

title: Two-time Cup winner Sullivan out as Pens coach
content: Mike Sullivan, who led the Pittsburgh Penguins to back-to-back Stanley Cups in 2016 and 2017, is out as the team's head coach, it was announced Monday.

title: Stojakovic's son, coveted transfer, picks Illinois
content: California transfer Andrej Stojakovic, the son of former NBA star Peja Stojakovic and one of the best available players in the portal, has committed to Illinois over Stanford and North Carolina.

title: Steelers cut CB Watts after career-ending injury
content: The Steelers have released Ryan Watts after the rookie suffered a neck injury last preseason, saying it's in his "best interest to discontinue playing football."

title: Warriors' Curry voted 2024-25 teammate of year
content: The Warriors' Stephen Curry, 37, has been named the 2024-25 Twyman-Stokes Teammate of the Year. Current NBA players voted for Curry, 37 who is a first-time winner of the award.

title: Son of Falcons coordinator behind Sanders prank
content: The son of Falcons defensive coordinator Jeff Ulbrich admitted to being the one behind a prank call to Shedeur Sanders during Day 2 of the NFL draft.

title: Entire WNBA preseason slate aired for first time
content: For the first time, every WNBA preseason game will be available via national broadcast or online streaming this year, with four games to be televised nationally.

title: Steph and Draymond's 'last ride' comes down to Playoff Jimmy
content: Ten years after their first title, Curry and Green know Butler is the key to their pursuit of a fifth ring.

title: After a painful draft weekend, Shedeur Sanders can still write his own story
content: From here on out, all that matters for Shedeur Sanders is proving the Browns were right in selecting him.

title: Stanley Cup playoff takeaways as Round 1 heats up: Who is poised to move on -- and why
content: Winnipeg is reeling, the Panthers are stirring things up and Toronto is looking for a finishing touch -- again.

title: How Arne Slot, Liverpool won the Premier League
content: It seemed impossible to follow club legend Jurgen Klopp and win the league in his first year, but Arne Slot has done just that at Liverpool.

title: Liverpool waited 35 years for this party
content: Liverpool waited 30 years and then won the Prem during a pandemic. This time they can finally celebrate.

title: Barcelona win dramatic Copa del Rey clásico, Liverpool clinch Premier League, more
content: Barcelona and Real Madrid didn't disappoint in a drama-filled Copa del Rey final, Liverpool finally clinched the Premier League and Inter Milan are wobbling at the worst time: Gab Marcotti recaps the weekend.

title: Slot sings to Klopp after Liverpool clinch PL title
content: Arne Slot sang Jürgen Klopp's name on the pitch at Anfield as Liverpool celebrated their Premier League title win.

title: MLS investigating discrimination in Vancouver win
content: MLS announced it is aware of a reported violation of the league's Non-Discrimination Policy that occurred in Sunday's match between Minnesota United FC and the Vancouver Whitecaps, and will "immediately begin a thorough review of the matter."

title: Arsenal comeback over Lyon 'unexplainable' - boss
content: Arsenal reached their first Women's Champions League final in 18 years on Sunday, taking down French powerhouse Lyon with a remarkable 4-1 away win.

title: Source: Ancelotti, Pérez to hold Madrid exit talks
content: Carlo Ancelotti will meet with Real Madrid president Florentino Pérez in the coming days to discuss the coach's departure from the club, a source told ESPN.

title: Wrexham plan 'no superstars' policy - Parkinson
content: Wrexham will operate a "no superstars and no egos" policy when they target new signings for their Premier League push next season.

title: Sources: Miami waives Gressel before Loons move
content: Inter Miami CF is waiving Julian Gressel, clearing the way for the midfielder to head to Minnesota United FC, sources tell ESPN.

title: McTominay double puts Napoli 3 clear in Serie A
content: Two first-half goals from Scott McTominay helped Napoli to a 2-0 home win against Torino in Serie A on Sunday as the hosts reclaimed the sole lead in the standings with four games left to play.

title: Liverpool clinch Prem title, match Man Utd record
content: Liverpool have been crowned Premier League champions after a 5-1 win over Tottenham on Sunday, securing their 20th league title.

title: UFC 318 reactions: What would a BMF title win mean for Dustin Poirier?
content: Dustin Poirier will take on ex-featherweight champion Max Holloway one last time for the BMF title at UFC 318.

title: Chelsea going backwards in UWCL as quadruple hopes crushed by Barcelona
content: Chelsea appeared closer than ever to winning the Champions League, but after a crushing defeat to Barcelona, they now seem further away than ever.

title: Wrexham's latest promotion is a miracle. The next will be even harder
content: Wrexham's third straight promotion has them on the Premier League's doorstep. Getting there will be much harder.

title: Eubank Jr. should focus on Canelo, rather than Benn rematch
content: Forget a rematch with Conor Benn, the focus for Chris Eubank Jr should now fully be on Canelo Alvarez

title: MLS Power Rankings: Vancouver, Miami still top; Portland hits form
content: After a sluggish start, the Portland Timbers are closing in on the elite teams in ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: Should you draft Caitlin Clark or A'ja Wilson at No. 1?
content: A'ja Wilson opened as the top ranked player in fantasy women's basketball entering the 2025 season, but does someone else have a case to supplant Wilson in 2025?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man Utd to trigger Cunha's $84M release clause
content: Is Matheus Cunha the man to solve Manchester United's attacking woes? Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Six days on, Pakistan yet to communicate with India whereabouts of detained BSF jawan
content: The jawan, P.K. Sahu, a resident of West Bengal, had crossed four or five metres into Pakistan while accompanying farmers

title: Kannur University’s internal mark entry system collapses
content: The failure, coming amid ongoing errors in the university’s examination system, has further deepened the academic crisis

title: Trained non-Brahmin archakas demand stipend of ₹15,000
content: They were trained in schools at temples under the purview of the Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowments Department

title: Mano Thangaraj re-inducted into Cabinet as Milk and Dairy Development Minister
content: This is part of the reshuffle that was necessitated after K. Ponmudy and V. Senthilbalaji resigned as Ministers on Sunday

title: T.N. government to reduce interest for late payment of property tax arrears in urban local bodies
content: A Bill to amend the Tamil Nadu Urban Local Bodies Act has been tabled in the Assembly. It seeks to impose 0.5% interest on unpaid property tax, simplify procedures for issuing business licences

title: Speaking at the Assembly, Palaniswami raises concern over rise of grave crimes in Tamil Nadu
content: He says fresh investigation will be ordered into Anna University sexual assault case if AIADMK returns to power in 2026

title: Drunk men thrash policeman and tear uniform at Bhopal railway station; one held, two at large
content: A purported video of the incident has also surfaced on social media showing a group of men pushing, aggressively punching and abusing constable Nazar Daulat Khan

title: P.M. Modi to inaugurate first media-entertainment ‘WAVES’ summit in Mumbai
content: Bringing together officials from 33 countries and numerous industry leaders, the World Audio Visual Entertainment Summit (WAVES) will be inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Mumbai on May 1.

title: LTVs and diplomat visas of Pakistan nationals remain valid, say officials
content: Officials clarified that of the 16 categories of visas issued to Pakistan nationals, two categories would remain valid after April 29 and that validity of the LTVs will not be impacted by the religious identity of the visa holders

title: T.N. government to regulate hoardings, digital banners, and placards in rural local bodies
content: A Bill to amend the Tamil Nadu Panchayats Act, 1994, accordingly was tabled by Minister for Rural Development I. Periyasamy in the Assembly on Monday

title: ₹20,000 costs imposed on petitioners seeking re-evaluation of Group-I mains scripts
content: Counsel for TGPSC pointed out that the person whose case was referred by the petitioners had not contested his revaluation resultsand was not among the petitioners

title: In 2024, India's military expenditure was nearly 9 times that of Pakistan: SIPRI
content: The country’s military expenditure, the fifth largest globally, grew by 1.6% to $86.1 billion while Pakistan spent $10.2 billion, according to the Stockholm International Peace Research Institute (SIPRI)

title: Bollywood chips in to urge tourists back to Kashmir, MEA appeals for travel advisories to be dropped
content: Centre and J&K government work to bring tourists back to J&K after the Pahalgam attack dealt a serious blow to the tourism industry there

title: Two booked for thrashing man on train over watching video on Pahalgam attack
content: The Government Railway Police in Madhya Pradesh said they are working to identify the two accused through CCTV footage

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister invites farmers of the capital region for relaunch ceremony of Amaravati development works
content: Naidu holds discussions with the farmers regarding their grievances and aspirations at his Undavalli residence

title: Centre introduces ‘Gyan Post’ to send textbooks at concessional rates
content: The service will have prices ranging from ₹20 to ₹100, for packages ranging from up to 300 grams to 5kg respectively

title: Rejected two-nation theory in 1947: Farooq Abdullah
content: The former CM says he always advocated for talks with Pakistan but one could not even think of talks with a nation that killed innocent people

title: Is there provision for emergency care on highways, SC asks Centre
content: The sharp comments from the Bench came while hearing a case over the delay in the implementation of the cashless scheme for treating road accident victims

title: Karnataka High Court directs State govt. to set up cyber investigation bureau or give life to cyber command centre with expert investigating officers
content: Court sets up SIT headed by DGP Pronab Mohaty to probe a case of alleged stealing of data from a private company supplying drones to defence sector

title: War is not an option; this is not a bad time to restore Statehood to J&K, says former RAW chief A.S. Dulat
content: ‘For the time being, everybody in Kashmir is one and all the Kashmiri leaders have said they are with Delhi...whatever the Government of India does, it should ensure to take the local Kashmiri along,’ Amarjit Singh Dulat, who has written extensively on J&K, said

title: A.P. CID police invite applications for home guard posts
content: Applications can be downloaded from https://cid.appolice.gov.in, and must be submitted between May 1 to 15, 2025.

title: Tripura police target netizens criticising security lapses in Kashmir
content: Sources say that at least seven people have recently been arrested, and many others are wanted for their posts discussing the security situation in Kashmir

title: Mayor’s helpdesk set to open at Thiruvananthapuram Corporation
content: Helpdesk will aid people, especially senior citizens, who have been finding it hard to use the government’s K-Smart platform. Personnel will also assist people in approaching the relevant section for various needs

title: Preterm newborn undergoes rare liver tumour resection at private hospital in Bengaluru
content: The male baby, born at 33 weeks on February 5 in a private hospital, started facing breathing difficulty

title: Human Rights Commission begins inquiry into Hubballi police encountering accused
content: The accused in a minor girl’s murder died after being shot at by police when he tried to escape after assaulting them

title: Forest department to strengthen local committees to tackle human-wildlife conflicts in Kerala
content: District-level committees will convene every month to assess the situation on the ground and adopt necessary action

title: Idukki diocese seeks immediate solution to construction curbs in the hill district
content: The basic rights of Idukki people are in limbo due to the restriction on construction activities says Idukki Bishop

title: Call to name Mananchira-Vellimadukunnu road after MGS
content: The committee said that the completion of the road was the last wish of MGS, which he had mentioned in his final letter to Union Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari

title: KSEB seeks revival of Athirappilly hydel project with a tourism twist
content: The contentious 163 MW hydel project planned at Athirappilly has remained in limbo for years, although the KSEB had never officially abandoned it

title: Kerosene distribution to resume in Kerala after nearly two years
content: Centre allocates 5,676 kilolitres of kerosene. Dearth of licensed wholesale dealers posing hurdles to distribution

title: Shaji N. Karun, creator of everlasting images, passes away
content: The maker of acclaimed films such as Piravi and Vanaprastham and the cinematographer of the likes of Kummatty and Panchavadippalam also played the role of an institution builder in the Malayalam film industry, helming the Chalachitra Academy and organising the IFFK. Shaji, who won laurels at the Cannes festival, was no stranger to the world stage

title: A.P. Minister urges local bodies to give top priority to waste management
content: Nearly 8 million tonnes of garbage had piled up during the YSRCP regime and Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu wants all the waste to be cleared by October 2, says P. Narayan

title: RSASTF officials arrest seven red sandalwood smugglers in Srikalahasti forest area, seize 72 logs worth ₹2.5 crore
content: Four of the arrested are identified as residents of Tirupati district and the other three as residents of Tamil Nadu, say police

title: TDP wrests Kuppam Municipality; YSRCP alleges corecive and unethical tactics
content: The threats and financial incentives by the TDP led to the defection of 10 YSRCP councillors, alleges MLC and warns of legal recourse against those who defied the party whip

title: Special trains to clear rush during holidays
content: These trains will run between SMVT Bengaluru-Belagavi, Vijayapura-SMVT Bengaluru and SMVT Bengaluru-Madurai

title: RJD MP Manoj K. Jha writes to PM Modi, calls for special session of Parliament on Pahalgam attack
content: The session, Mr. Jha said, is essential to pay ‘heartful homage’ to the victims of the attack, honour their memory and reaffirm our shared commitment to the ideals of unity, justice and peace

title: 40 fisherfolk SHGs to be trained in seaweed farming in Konaseema
content: The search is on to identify suitable brackish water areas along the coastal belt near Gachakayalapora, S. Yanam and Razole in Konaseema

title: 17 terrorists killed by security forces in Pakistan
content: Pakistani security forces kill 17 terrorists near Pakistan-Afghanistan border, bringing total to 71 in three days

title: Madras High Court reserves orders on plea for CBI probe in Pallikaranai honour killing case
content: Justice G.K. Ilanthiraiyan defers his verdict on a plea made by the father of the deceased to quash the chargesheet filed by Tambaram city police

title: Students should play important role in development of Amaravati, says Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu
content: Naidu promises the students that he will take care of bringing the best universities and best minds to Amaravati

title: Special squads yet to be formed to check illegal constructions
content: Local action committee leaders allege that rules meant for regularising constructions are being misused to legitimise illegal projects, including the conversion of wetlands and paddy fields

title: CBI begins probe into charge of illegal amassment of wealth by K.M. Abraham
content: Probe will cover bureaucrat’s government service years from 2003 to 2015, later as the member secretary of KIIFB, and his current term as CM’s Chief Principal Secretary. Mr. Abraham has alleged a criminal conspiracy to defame him by a coterie of corrupt PSU high honchos

title: Playoffs daily: Round 4 of the Battle of Florida, pivotal Game 5 for Avs-Stars
content: home teams are on a tear in the 2025 Stanley Cup playoffs, going 21-10 thus far . the early matchup is Game 4 of the Battle of Florida . Tampa Bay Lightning forward Brandon Hagel was given a major penalty for his hit on Florida Panthers captain Aleksander Barkov in Game 2 .

title: College baseball Week 11: Top 25 rankings and what to watch
content: the longhorns remain the top of the class in all of baseball and the SEC . but it was the only top team to hold onto its spot as the rest of the top 10 underwent quite a shakeup . this week's biggest climber is NC State, which jumped 12 spots to no. 13 after sweeping Clemson .

title: Garcia? Teofimo? Canelo? Inoue? A Lapsed fan's guide to boxing's biggest weekend of 2025
content: this weekend will see three consecutive nights of fight cards featuring four current or former ESPN pound-for-pound fighters . Easily the most unique location of the weekend is Times Square in New York City, where Garcia, Haney and Lopez will compete in separate fights in the renowned public space .

title: 6-team mock draft: How early did Paige Bueckers go?
content: the 2025 WNBA season is set to tip off on may 16, the ESPN experts came together for a fantasy women's basketball mock draft . we used the default settings -- a six-team league with nine players per team and the following scoring system . the participants of this mock draft were Charlie Creme, Eric Moody, Jason Shebilske, andre Snellings .

title: Transfer portal's lure involves more than just a big payday for players
content: Clayton Powell-Lee has spent the past month searching for an answer . he can build on his 53 tackles last season, after which he landed a six-figure name, image and likeness contract with the school . the market for defensive backs is booming, his agents say .

title: Pistons' adjustments, Warriors' needs: What we learned in the first week of the playoffs
content: the Eastern Conference has been a battleground, as the no. 4 seed Denver Nuggets and the fifth-seeded LA Clippers are neck and neck after opening up their series with an overtime thriller followed by a game-winning buzzer-beating dunk from Denver's Aaron Gordon . the future of the 7-seed Golden State Warriors remains a mystery .

title: In Video, Unaware Tourist On Zipline Captures Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: A tourist who was on a zipline ride during a trip to Jammu & Kashmir's Pahalgam last week inadvertently captured the terrorist attack that left 26 civilians dead, according to a new video that has emerged on social media.

title: Power Cut Chaos In Spain, Portugal, Operator Points To 'Rare Phenomenon'
content: Millions in Spain, Portugal and parts of southern France were affected by a rare power outage, bringing traffic, trains and regular activities to a halt, causing panic among people.

title: Islamic Court Judgments Not Legally Valid Or Enforceable: Supreme Court
content: Islamic courts like "Qazi's Court", "Kaziyat's Court (Darul Qaza)" or "Sharia Court' have no recognition in law, the Supreme Court has reiterated.

title: Video: Siddaramaiah's Slap Gesture At Cop After He Loses Cool On Stage
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah snapped at a police officer during a Congress rally today. The Chief Minister lost his cool and nearly slapped the police officer after he was shown black flags at the rally in Belagavi.

title: As Canada Votes, Trump Says 'They Would Face Zero Tariffs If...'
content: Canadians are heading to the polls to elect a new government that will navigate the country's relations with the United States, particularly in light of President Donald Trump's aggressive trade policies and annexation threats.

title: 65 Dead, Over 1,000 Injured In Iran Port Fire, Blast Heard 50 Km Away: 10 Points
content: Smoke shrouded Iran's largest commercial port and surrounding areas as a fire following a major blast killed 40 people and injured more than 1,000 so far. Strong winds posed hindrances to firefighting operations.

title: Trump Wants Permanent Russia-Ukraine Ceasefire: White House
content: US President Donald Trump wants to see a permanent ceasefire to ending Russia's war in Ukraine, White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt said on Monday.

title: Malayalam Rapper Vedan Arrested After Ganja Seized From His Flat: Cops
content: Popular Malayalam rapper and songwriter Vedan and eight others were arrested after ganja was seized from his flat in Tripunithura here on Monday, police said.

title: Legendary Malayalam Filmmaker Shaji N Karun Dies At 73
content: Legendary Malayalam filmmaker and cinematographer Shaji N Karun, known for his pathbreaking films and distinctive style of movie making, died here on Monday, industry sources said.

title: "Everything Is Totally Out Of Control": Spain Brought To Halt By Huge Blackout
content: Panicked customers scrambled to withdraw cash from banks and streets overflowed with crowds trying in vain to get a signal as a Spain-wide power outage plunged the country into chaos on Monday.

title: 'Indian Attack Imminent, Have Reinforced Forces': Pak Minister To Reuters
content: Pakistan's defence minister said on Monday that a military incursion by India was imminent in the aftermath of a deadly terrorist attack on tourists in Kashmir last week,

title: Putin Announces Ukraine Ceasefire May 8-10
content: The ceasefire is taking place on Russia's Victory Day on May 9th, which marks the end of the Second World War.

title: UN Food Programme To Slash Quarter Of Staff As Funding Falls
content: The UN World Food Programme will cut staff by 25 to 30 percent as funding for the global aid agency plummets, according to an internal email seen Monday by AFP.

content: The Youth Tipra Federation or YTF, the youth wing of the ruling BJP's alliance partner Tipra Motha party, staged a major protest on Monday at Bankar Market near the Bangladesh border in south Tripura,

title: New Pahalgam Attack Video Emerges, Shows Tourists Hiding Behind Kiosk
content: A new video showing the helpless tourists at Pahalgam during the attack is being widely circulated online. Terrorists belonging to an offshoot of Lashkar e Taiba had mowed down 26 people -- only one of them a local -- during the attack on April 22.

title: Nawaz Sharif Asks Pak PM Not To Take Aggressive Stance Against India: Report
content: Three-time Pakistan Prime Minister and founder of the ruling political party, Pakistan Muslim League - Nawaz, Nawaz Sharif, has advised his younger brother and current Prime Minister, Shehbaz Sharif, to utilise all available diplomatic resources.

title: Live Updates: Millions Across Spain, Portugal, France Face Sudden Power Outage
content: Spain Power Outage: Millions are facing a power outage in Spain, Portugal and parts of southern France. The cause for the outage was not immediately identified.

title: Father Dies Of Heart Attack While Celebrating Daughter's UPSC Success In Maharashtra
content: Prahlad Khandare, a retired extension officer of the Pusad Panchayat Samiti, died of a heart attack while celebrating his daughter's success in the prestigious UPSC examination.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Heft? History? What Pak's Real Motive Behind Pahalgam Attack Could Be
content: The attack may be similar to what happened in Israel, but the histories are entirely different. And so, logically, the reactions should be.

title: Adani Total Gas Reports 15% Operational Revenue Growth In Q4 FY2025
content: Adani Total Gas Limited (ATGL) on Monday reported strong results, with revenue from operations increasing by 15 per cent at Rs 1,448 crore in Q4 FY25.
